wikipedia_page.main: Major-General Sir Amos Godsell Robert Norcott CB KCH (3 August 1777 – 8 January 1838) was an English soldier of the 95th Rifles fought throughout the Peninsular War and at the Battle of Waterloo where he commanded a battalion. He later served as an acting Governor of Jamaica, before becoming the commander of Cork District.

response: Norcott married Mary Emily Kinahan on the 14 July 1892 and they had six children. Charles' father William Norcott was also a general in the Rifles who served during the Crimean War. His grandfather Amos Norcott commanded the 2nd Battalion, Rifle Brigade at Waterloo.Schneider 2012 He also had an uncle named Charles Rossmore Robert Norcott who gained renown for his service as a superintendent of the Western Australia Police.
